verse.roman:
athāsīd vāruṇī devī
kanyā kamala-locanā
asurā jagṛhus tāṁ vai
harer anumatena te

synonyms: atha—thereafter (after the appearance of the goddess of fortune); āsīt—there was; vāruṇī—Vāruṇī; devī—the demigoddess who controls drunkards; kanyā—a young girl; kamala-locanā—lotus-eyed; asurāḥ—the demons; jagṛhuḥ—accepted; tām—her; vai—indeed; hareḥ—of the Supreme Personality of Godhead; anumatena—by the order; te—they (the demons).
translation: Next appeared Vāruṇī, the lotus-eyed goddess who controls drunkards. With the permission of the Supreme Personality of Godhead, Kṛṣṇa, the demons, headed by Bali Mahārāja, took possession of this young girl.
